chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney Alan Ingalls was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: w/huber - Court not opposed to being served in Lincoln or Langlade Counties.

Defendant Rodney Alan Ingalls in court, in custody with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  State informs the court that they amending the charge to PAC 3rd.  State put reasons for the amendment on the record.  Court accepts the amendment.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to the amended Count 1.   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court orders:
$1694.00 fine 60 dtp
45 days jail w/huber starts today can serve in Langlade or Lincoln County.
AODA assessment and treatment
DL Revoked for 24 months
  Pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court orders that for a period of 24 months, beginning on _5/10/17_, each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration be equipped with an ignition interlock device.

Also, pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court further orders that for a period of _24_ months, beginning on the date the Department of Transportation issues any license to the defendant granted under Ch. 343, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the defendant's operating privileges for the operation of Class D vehicles be restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device.

5 days sentence credit

Defendant Rodney Alan Ingalls in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  No victim rights issues. Court has a question of the officer for clarification. Rodney Alan Ingalls(deft)  duly sworn and testifies.  Defense takes a break to talk with the deft. State to respons by December 1st, Defense would like until until December 15th for rebuttal brief.  Defense to letter regarding the briefing schedule.

Scheduling conference on July 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.
#1 - video of stopped - MOR (disk is stored in the vault)

Defendant Rodney Alan Ingalls in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called appearances given at 9:09 am.  Do to the late filing of a motion from the defense and state which will take time to figure it out and the State requests an adjournment.  Defense informs the court as to what their motion involues.  Out of State OWI charges as a 1st would make this charge different.  State feels that it would take a couple of days to figure out the counts. Court will grant the adjournment.  Court has the jurors brought into the courtroom at 9:22 am.  Court addresses the jury.  Court excuses the jury at 9:25 am

Court will hear the motions that were filed.  Defense requests sequestion.  Court grants.
Matthew Waid  duly sworn and testifies.  Tyler Tesch  duly sworn and testifies.  Defense recalls Officer Matthew Waid   Back on the record at 10:15 am.  Video is being watched and Officer Waid is verifing the video.  Officer Tesch is back on the witness stand to verify some of the video.  Officers are excused no other witnesses from either party 10:45 am.   Arguements heard.  Court rules that in regards to the motion for Miranda that the state has not meet its burden of proof in that regards. In regards to the motion for Goodchild - no Goodchild violation and that the statements made would be admissible in rebuttal only.   Any statements made by the deft cannot be used in case and chief  If the deft testifies and asked how many prior convictions the answer would be 9.  Court to take a break.  Back on the record at 11:16 am.  Court to hear Defense Motion in Limine.  #6 is agreed to, #7 is mute. #1 - Defense stipulates to the court that has been meet, jury not to make findings - granted;  #2 - Need to know outcome of Count 1 hold on this; #3 -Will take care of later #4 granted #5 - granted  state can ask - answer - not having a valid driving status.

Court directs the State to file an amended information.  Once the defense receives an amended information in regards to Count 3 and will waive reading and enters a not guilty plea. Amended information to be filed by 4:00 pm on 7/1/16.

Defense will have a response by 7/18/16 and the State reply by 7/25/16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 08:00 am.
